page.title: 15TOURISM 1
page.content: The town caters for a daily influx of between 20,000 to 30,000 tourists per day.Some are resident in the local hotels,guest houses and self catering establishments,the majority come from the nine holiday camps in the surrounding area.A few arrive by car, coach and train from other resorts in Devon and Cornwall.Looe has a great deal to offer the tourist with idealic walks along the Cornwall Coastal Footpath in an easterly direction and to the west as far as the next resort of Polperro.One can visit Looe Island (St.Georges Island)where the author of "We bought an Island" is resident.The main town beach offers the tourist the safest beach in Cornwall and when the tide is out a very large expanse of white sand.The beach at Hannafore offers many interesting rock pools to be investigated.
